metadata.title: CVE-2017-12154 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
The prepare_vmcs02 function in arch/x86/kvm/vmx.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.13.3 does not ensure that the "CR8-load exiting" and "CR8-storeexiting" L0 vmcs02 controls exist in cases where L1 omits the "use TPRshadow" vmcs12 control, which allows KVM L2 guest OS users to obtain readand write access to the hardware CR8 register.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

No subscription required
